document_data.name: Eagle Tribe
document_data.mainbody: The '''eagle tribe''' was part of the [[Azuposi]] nation of the [[Pasocada Basin]] of northern [[Maztica]] in the 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Base of Operations: In addition to inhabiting the Pasocada Basin, the eagle tribe maintained a center near the heart of [[Michaca]], the City of Gold.
document_data.History: The eagle tribe was one of six separate tribes that composed the Azuposi people. They represented the northern direction on the compass and their sacred animal was the [[eagle]].
